H0.text: Metamorphic is the class of rock that the large rocky outcroppings of basalt, formed by ancient lava flows in the Four Corners area of the US Southwest, belong to.

H1.text: Sedimentary is the class of rock that large rocky outcroppings of basalt in the Four Corners area of the US Southwest, formed by ancient lava flows, are.

H2.text: Igneous is the class of rock formed by ancient lava flows, as exemplified by the large rocky outcroppings of basalt in the Four Corners area in the US Southwest.

H3.text: Weathered is the class of rock that describes the large basaltic outcroppings in the Four Corners area, formed by ancient lava flows.

A4.text: Igneous rocks are formed through the cooling and solidification of magma or lava.

A5.text: Extrusive igneous rock, also known as volcanic rock, is formed by the cooling of molten magma on the earth's surface.
